Adoption & Rehoming

Our mission is simple: to provide lifelong care, compassionate rehoming, and advocacy for aging felines. If you're looking to adopt, volunteer, donate, or simply learn more about the beauty of senior cat companionship, you've come to the right place.

Welcome to our family—where age is never a barrier to love.

Are you ready to adopt one of our sweethearts or looking for a new home for your loved one?
Fill in our form and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.

Contact form

Ready for Adoption

Adorable companions waiting for loving homes to spend their golden years. Each one of them are vaccinated, spayed or nutured and using their litter-box.

They are full of personality and deeply appreciative of love. Adopt now and make a lifelong difference in a wise friend's life.

Click the images to read more about the cats

Pro tips from our veterinarians

  • Feed age-appropriate food

    Choose high-quality senior cat food to support joint, kidney, and overall health.

  • Make litter box access easy

    Put the box in easily accessible locations to accommodate mobility issues.

  • Monitor weight and eating habits

    Sudden changes can indicate health issues.

  • Offer soft bedding and warm spots

    Older cats may have arthritis and prefer padded, warm places to rest.

  • Keep up with regular vet check-ups

    At least twice a year to catch potential issues early.

  • Groom regularly

    Senior cats may groom less, so help them with brushing and checking for mats or skin problems.

  • Use ramps or stairs if needed

    Help them reach favorite spots without jumping.

  • Watch for signs of pain or illness

    Limping, hiding, vocal changes, or behavioral shifts warrant a vet visit.

And most important:

Give them love and patience - Senior cats thrive with gentle care and a strong emotional bond.
